overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish an adjudication system and procedures to process fireworks infractions. [1] This bill amends and establishes various definitions and penalties for firework offenses, including establishing heightened penalties under certain circumstances, and establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnics. [1] Creating a fireworks infractions system will allow law enforcement agencies and the judiciary to quickly and efficiently process low-level cases, while also allowing them to prioritize higher-level cases as appropriate. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 to carry out the purposes of this Act. [1] The appropriation is to update the judiciary information management system to implement the adjudications process established by section 2 of this Act. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]

agency_impact: This bill will impact the judiciary by requiring it to establish and manage a new adjudication system for fireworks infractions, similar to the existing traffic infraction system. [1] The judiciary will need to update its information management system to implement the new process. [1] The prosecuting attorney will represent the State in trials and concurrent trials for fireworks infractions. [1]
economic_impact: The bill is expected to generate revenue through a variety of fines and fees. [1] Of the fines collected, the court shall pay twenty per cent to the State and eighty per cent to the county in which the fine was imposed, which shall be expended by the county for law enforcement purposes. [1] The legislature finds that improved enforcement of fireworks control laws is necessary to protect property from avoidable fire damage and the community from injuries and other negative impacts. [1]
policy_impact: This Act establishes a new chapter in the Hawaii Revised Statutes to create a dedicated adjudication system for fireworks infractions. [1] It amends and establishes various definitions and penalties for firework offenses, including heightened penalties for offenses that result in injury or death. [1] The bill also establishes various new criminal offenses, including class A, B, and C felonies for certain violations. [1]
